news_header: Pope Francis has been diagnosed with a complex respiratory infection involving multiple organisms. At 88 years old, his medical history raises concerns, and he will require targeted drug treatment.
news_original_title: Vatican says the pope has a &#8216;polymicrobial respiratory tract infection.&#8217; What is that?
news_text: Experts suggest that while healthy individuals may recover quickly from similar infections, the Pope's age and previous lung issues complicate his situation. The treatment may involve antibiotics and physiotherapy, but the effectiveness will depend on his response in the coming days.
